entry.title: Boost Resource Loading With fetchpriority, A New Priority Hint
entry.summary: This new attribute will enable us to fine-tune relative resource priority, improve LCP performance, deprioritize JavaScript fetch calls, and much more. Let‚Äôs check out fetchpriority and explore some potential use cases.

entry.title: Dynamic Data-Fetching In An Authenticated Next.js App
entry.summary: Data is among the most important things that make up a web application or a conventional native app. We need data to be able to see and perhaps understand the purpose of an application. In this article, we‚Äôll look at another approach to obtaining data in an application that requires authentication or authorization using Next.js.

entry.title: How To Get Work Done: Wrangling Stakeholders And Overcoming Obstacles

entry.title: How To Build A Progressively Enhanced, Accessible, Filterable And Paginated List
entry.summary: Ever wondered how to build a paginated list that works with and without JavaScript? In this article, Manuel explains how you can leverage the power of Progressive Enhancement and do just that with Eleventy and Alpine.js.

entry.title: SmashingConf Is Back In 2022
entry.summary: After two years when almost everything moved online, 2022 marks the return of in-person conferences. In fact, [SmashingConf is back](https://smashingconf.com/conferences): coming to San Francisco and Austin in June, Freiburg (Germany) in September, and New York in October.

entry.title: A Guide To Hover And Pointer Media Queries
entry.summary: In this article, we‚Äôll talk about how to adapt our sites to the different scenarios of a device pointer: whether it has a pointer or not, or how accurate it is. To adapt our site to those devices‚Äô needs we‚Äôll talk about how to properly use media queries `hover`, `pointer`, `any-hover` and `any-pointer`.
